newsitem.title: USA: Corvas starts Phase I trial of NAPc2.
newsitem.headline: Corvas starts Phase I trial of NAPc2.

text.p: Corvas International Inc said it initiated a Phase Ia clinical trial to assess the safety and effects of its anticoagulant, recombinant NAPc2.

"This first trial ... will primarily be to demonstrate safety, but should also demonstrate the feasibility of adminstering this compound subcutaneously, the anticoagulant effects of increasing dosage levels, and the duration of the compound in the bloodstream following administration," Randall Woods, Corvas president and chief executive officer said in a statement.
NAPc2 is designed to treat deep vein thrombosis, which often occurs as a complication of orthopedic surgery, and can lead to the formation of blood clots in the major veins in the leg.
